title: Difficulty installing Owl for Exchange addon on Thunderbird Windows
content:
Hello everyone,

I hope you're doing well. I am currently facing an issue with installing the Owl for Exchange addon on Thunderbird for Windows. I have successfully installed it on Linux, but unfortunately, I'm unable to replicate the process on my Windows machine.

The purpose of installing this addon is to synchronize my institutional Outlook account with Thunderbird. Despite following the installation steps carefully, the addon doesn't seem to work properly, in fact doesn't appear as an option when I try to add an account. I've tried reinstalling Thunderbird and the addon multiple times, but with no success.

I was wondering if anyone else has encountered a similar problem or has any idea why this might be happening specifically on Windows. Are there any additional configurations or dependencies required for the addon to work on Windows? Any insights or suggestions would be greatly appreciated.

Thank you in advance for your assistance!

Best regards,
creator: davidrojaslizama

title: TB does not sync ALL iCloud contacts
content:
Hi.

I am using TB 102.11.2 (64-Bit) in German. Installed add on "Provider for CalDAV & CardDAV" and "TbSync". My iCloud contact list contains more than 300 addresses.

If I create a new contact in TB, it will be immediately synced to iCloud. If I change a contact in TB, it will also be immediately synced to iCloud. But I have two contacts, which are not synced, and I dont know why. This contacts I imported to TB from Outlook via .vcf file. Both contains images of the users. And both are shown in TB.

I am unsure, if "Provider for CalDAV & CardDAV" is necessary, I read a post with the info, that TB includes now native support for both protocols. Nevertheless, the problem still exists, even if I deactive this add on and sync again.

In the past, I also have had a problem with some contacts. I think it was a problem with some

Where can I find a log? How to debug this problem? Please help...

Thank you for your help! Kai
creator: kai-fr23fx

title: Outgoing email
content:
I have 3 email accounts that all receive emails just fine. Outgoing mail however only works with one of the accounts. The other two recieve this response from the server: Sending of the message failed. An error occurred while sending mail. The mail server responded: Please ensure your email address and authenticating user match when sending messages. Please verify that your email address is correct in your account settings and try again. I have tried every fix on the thread and researched the web to no avail. This just does not make sense as this problem just materialized out of thin air. What is going wrong?

Thanks for your help!
creator: dubbls
